EXTRACTED VALUE: Celtics center Kendrick Perkins (ACL surgery) hopes to resume playing by January, but the team doesn't expect him back until February or March.
Ronny Turiaf (knee) will return for the Knicks vs. Minnesota on Monday.
Reggie Evans tweeted that he'll have surgery on his fractured foot December 2.
The Pistons may soon invite another young big man to training camp, though they already have 15 players under contract.
Beat writer Mike Wells reports that Jim O'Brien is not planning to use Jeff Foster (ankle) at power forward upon his return.
Juwan Howard, who has been cleared to play on Friday, will wear a mask to protect his broken nose.
Pau Gasol (hamstring) did not practice on Saturday.
Nenad Krstic (back) started at center against the Hornets on Monday, moving Serge Ibaka back to the bench.
Carlos Boozer had 12 points and two rebounds in 21 minutes on Friday.
Andris Biedrins grabbed 18 rebounds on Tuesday against the Spurs, and also added four points on 2-of-6 shooting and two assists.
The Nets officially signed forward Joe Smith on Friday.
Nuggets forward Kenyon Martin (knee) should have a timetable for his return after meeting with an orthopedic specialist after Thanksgiving weekend.
Dwight Howard, J.J. Redick, and Mickael Pietrus will all be ready to play on Monday night.
Chris Kaman (sprained ankle) was visibly frustrated after aggravating his injury on Sunday, and his status for Monday's game is in doubt.
Pistons big man Chris Wilcox remains sidelined with a hamstring injury.
Timberwolves center Ryan Hollins was traded to the Cavaliers as part of Monday's four-player swap.
Andrew Bynum is targeting a return sometime during the Lakers' upcoming six-game road trip, but the Lakers have not announced a set timetable.
Free agent center Johan Petro has reached agreement on a three year, $10 million deal with the Nets, according to Yahoo! Sports.
Brian Skinner saw 28 minutes in Saturday's game when the Bucks starting frontcourt of Drew Gooden and Ersan Ilyasova got into early foul trouble.
Leon Powe said recently that his knee is 100% healthy and he can now squat 275 pounds.
DeSagana Diop (dizzy spells) would return to action on Friday.
The Mavericks signed free agent forward Steve Novak.
Chris Andersen is day-to-day with a bruised lower back -- X-rays were negative but he is questionable to play on Sunday.
Eddy Curry did not play on Saturday against the Clippers, one day after missing Friday's game to attend to a family matter.
Rockets forward Jared Jeffries has decided not to opt out of the final year of his contract, worth $6.9 million.
Melvin Ely will start in place for Nene for the Nuggets on Friday.
Josh Childress is expected to continue playing with a splint on his hand for two more weeks.
Andrew Bogut (back) will start on Monday against the Heat, as expected.
As expected, Zydrunas Ilgauskas will remain the Heat's starting center, with newly acquired Erick Dampier to be worked in slowly off the bench.
The Knicks have reached out to veteran PF/C Kurt Thomas.
One game after his first start of the season, Hakim Warrick plummeted down the Suns' depth chart and wound up playing just nine minutes off the bench.
The Wizards are expecting Hilton Armstrong to be suspended for Wednesday's game in Toronto.
Brandon Bass had 17 points and five rebounds on 5-of-8 shooting in Wednesday's win over the Bulls.
Theo Ratliff underwent successful knee surgery on Tuesday, and is expected to be out a minimum of 4-6 weeks.
Marcus Camby was benched after playing just under three minutes of the first half of Friday's game.
Malik Allen cited a great relationship with George Karl and the Nuggets in general as a reason he would like to play for them again next season.
Zaza Pachulia sat out the second half of Tuesday's game with a hip flexor injury.
Nazr Mohammed is back in the starting lineup for the Bobcats, pushing Tyrus Thomas back to the bench.
Dahntay Jones remains on the trading block, according to the Indianapolis Star.
Sean Marks (sprained ankle) did not play in Portland's loss to the Nets on Sunday.
Clippers PF Craig Smith plans to appeal the Flagrant-2 foul that got him ejected from Monday's game.
Amir Johnson quietly had a perfect night with 14 points, nine rebounds, a steal and a block in 31 minutes of Friday's win.
Impending free agent G Anthony Carter said he hopes to sign a one-year deal to remain in Denver.
Coach Alvin Gentry does not appear concerned about the foot sprain Grant Hill suffered in Wednesday's practice.
Etan Thomas, who hasn't played since Dec. 4, had four points and three rebounds in 15 minutes of Wednesday's loss.
Jason Maxiell started at power forward again on Wednesday but hit just 1-of-6 shots for two points and four rebounds.
Elton Brand served his one-game suspension on Wednesday and is ready to return vs. the Heat on Friday.
Kwame Brown is ready to make his season debut for the Bobcats on Monday.
Pacers big man Solomon Jones has grabbed a mere three rebounds in 58 minutes of action this season.
Free agent C D.J. Mbenga is reportedly close to a one-year deal with the Hornets.
Louis Amundson (finger) is practicing with the Warriors and hopes to return in a week to 10 days.
Jamaal Magloire had six points, nine rebounds and three blocks in Wednesday's win.
Jason Collins will start at center on Friday against the Wolves, moving Al Horford to power forward and Josh Smith to small forward.
Joey Graham scored 12 points on 5-of-10 shooting (including two threes) with three rebounds, one assist, one steal, and one block in 29 minutes.
David Lee scored 18 points on 7-of-12 shooting with seven rebounds, five assists, and two steals on Tuesday.
Francisco Elson finally made his debut for the Jazz after returning from an injured hamstring.
Shelden Williams had eight points, 13 rebounds and zero blocks on Friday.
Anderson Varejao is still being held out of contact drills in practice due to his bruised ribs.
76ers center Tony Battie suffered a quad strain on Saturday and is listed day-to-day.
Jermaine O'Neal (knee), who is with the team for Sunday's game in New Jersey, will participate in an on-court workout tomorrow.
Brendan Haywood scored seven points on 3-of-7 shooting with 10 rebounds and one assist in 21 minutes on Wednesday.
Ronnie Brewer played 18 minutes on Saturday as he looks to get back on track after a hamstring injury cost him his projected starting spot.
Drew Gooden (plantar fasciitis) did not practice on Friday, instead resting his left heel.
Shaun Livingston played 15 minutes on Wednesday, finishing with zero points and three assists off the bench.
Chuck Hayes started at center for the Rockets and had eight points and eight rebounds in Monday's loss.
Joel Przybilla is finally over his stomach flu and should be ready to make his season debut on Friday.
Thunder signed C Nick Collison to a four-year contract extension.
